text: Cross, third standing redshirted player from left, with the Moncton Victorias in 1912–13. John Albert "Jack" Cross (August 19, 1887 - November 16, 1948Hockey deaths - November 1948) was a Canadian professional ice hockey player. He played most notably with the Toronto Ontarios of the National Hockey Association in 1913–14. He also played with the Moncton Victorias in the Maritime Professional Hockey League. ==References== Category:1887 births Category:1948 deaths Category:People from Ingersoll, Ontario Category:Toronto Ontarios players Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders
title: Jack Cross (ice hockey)
